info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:10PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, southwestern Berkshire, northeastern Dutchess and southeastern Columbia Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 909 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pine Plains, or 15 miles east of Rhinebeck, moving northeast at 15 mph. This storm has broad low to mid level rotation associated with it. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sharon around 925 PM EDT. Millerton around 930 PM EDT. Falls Village around 950 PM EDT. Sheffield, Canaan and Ashley Falls around 1000 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include South Norfolk, Cornwall, Sodom, Pachin Mills, Ancramdale, South Canaan, Lithgow, Wangum Village, Gomorrah and Kelly Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
